intro: Tithymalus flaccidus, commonly known as the flaccid tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a cluster. Tithymalus flaccidus is often found in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
